message.content:
cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.AR, cs.OS, cs.NI 

The paper discusses a mechanism for high-performance distributed data-centric computations, which suggests that it could belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The paper also mentions distributed hash tables and logging schemes, which are commonly studied in the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category. The use of Input/Output Memory Management Unit (IOMMU) and virtualized global address space suggests that the paper could also belong to the Architecture (cs.AR) and Operating Systems (cs.OS) sub-categories. Finally, the paper discusses the use of RDMA hardware, which is commonly studied in the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-category.
